abstract: The $7.1 billion deal will finance Repsol’s plan to develop offshore fields in Brazil.
snippet: The $7.1 billion deal will finance Repsol’s plan to develop offshore fields in Brazil.
lead_paragraph: Repsol, the Spanish oil company, said Friday that it had sold a 40 percent stake in its Brazilian unit to Sinopec for $7.1 billion as it prepared to develop offshore fields like those that led to the $70 billion Petrobras initial public offering last week.

headline.main: Repsol Sells 40% Stake to Chinese Oil Producer
headline.print_headline: Repsol Sells 40% Stake To Chinese Oil Producer
